findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract modifies the state of variables without checking if their current value is the same as the one given as an argument, resulting in redundant storage writes.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that their value is initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The Solidity style guide provides guidelines for writing clean and consistent Solidity code, including naming conventions for functions, variables, contracts, structs, enums, and constants. Adhering to these conventions improves readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.
